patterns.command

Command pattern utilities.

Provides a small command framework used to encapsulate actions as objects. Includes concrete commands for building structures and conveyors and a command history manager that supports undo/redo. The implementation aims to be defensive and non-intrusive so it can be integrated with the game’s existing managers.

class patterns.command.BuildConveyorCommand(gameManager, conveyorCreator, start_pos, end_pos)

Bases: Command

Command to build a conveyor between two points.

On execute the command creates the conveyor, appends it to the game manager lists and deducts points. Undo removes the conveyor and refunds points.

execute()

Ejecuta el comando Returns: True si tuvo éxito, False si falló

Return type:

bool

get_description()

Retorna descripción del comando para UI

Return type:

str

undo()

Deshace el comando Returns: True si tuvo éxito, False si falló

Return type:

bool

class patterns.command.BuildStructureCommand(gameManager, creator, position)

Bases: Command

Command to build a structure using a provided creator.

The command checks the game manager’s points against the computed cost, creates the structure, places it on the map, deducts points, and supports undo which removes the structure and refunds points.

execute()

Construye la estructura si hay puntos suficientes

Return type:

bool

get_description()

Retorna descripción del comando para UI

Return type:

str

undo()

Deshace la construcción, devolviendo puntos

Return type:

bool

class patterns.command.Command

Bases: ABC

Base interface for commands.

Implementations must provide execute and undo methods. Both methods return a boolean indicating success.

abstractmethod execute()

Ejecuta el comando Returns: True si tuvo éxito, False si falló

Return type:

bool

Retorna descripción del comando para UI

Return type:

Deshace el comando Returns: True si tuvo éxito, False si falló

Return type:

bool

class patterns.command.CommandHistory(max_history=50)

Bases: object

Manages a history of executed commands supporting undo/redo.

Stores a bounded list of Command instances and exposes execute, undo, and redo operations. execute will run the command and add it to the history only on success.

can_redo()

Verifica si se puede rehacer

Return type:
